results.title: The Money fish
results.creator_credit: Angela Borelli, Two-Up Films, Film Victoria, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Janet McLeod
results.brief_description: Winter in Corner Inlet, Welshpool, Victoria and local commercial fishermen are angry with environmentalists and the Victorian Government who are intent on setting up marine national parks along the Victorian coastline to boost fishing stocks and restrict professional net fishing. Angst also exists between the commercial fishermen and those who practise recreational fishing. For Joe Pizzone, who has given up 26 years of shark fishing in Bass Strait for a new life as an inlet fisherman, owning his own boat and spending more time with his family, the threat of marine parks to his livelihood becomes the new challenge in his life. The documentary follows Joe as he goes about his daily life as a professional fisherman, revealing the harsh conditions, the long hours and the constant battle with the weather, the good days and the bad days and his absolute passion and determination to not just stand by and let bureaucracy and the “greenies” take over without a fight. His loyalty to the community and the local commercial fishing families sees Joe confronting the Environment Conservation Council head-on and taking a pro-active stance in defending the local community’s right to fish and earn a living. This is an interesting film in that it attempts to present all sides of such a vexatious issue, from the commercial fishermen to the proponents of recreational fishing, the Government and the environmentalists. NB: Warning contains some strong language.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Angela Borelli, Two-Up Films, Film Victoria, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Janet McLeod

results.title: The Mondragon experiment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Mondragon in the Basque region of Spain, is an industrial town where more than 80 factories are co-operatively owned by the workers. All this has been created with scant help from a suspicious government and no funds from stock-market investors. It has run successfully for twenty-five years. The workers run the factories and appoint the managers, run their own bank, technical college and research laboratories. In Britain, workers and management have been at loggerheads since the Industrial Revolution. Examines the feasability of Britain following the same road to prosperity. Narrated by Alexander John

results.title: The Molluscs
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Intertidal Life of the North American Pacific Coast”.
The marine fauna of the British Columbian coast is extremely diverse. The more common animals of the phylum molluscs from the classes Amphineura, Gastropoda, Pelecypoda, Cephalopoda are illustrated. Shows their size, habitat and feeding habits. Industrialisation and pollution have led to the destruction of many molluscs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Mole in the zoo (K)
results.creator_credit: Short Film Studio, Ceskoslovensky Filmexport and Zdenek Miler
results.brief_description: An amusing animated film concerning the adventures of a clever little mole who finds himself in a zoo. This time the mole goes where angels fear to tread. He decides to help an ailing lion by pulling his throbbing tooth. No narration, music only. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Mole concept
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: chemistry”.
The mole is the ultimate standard container for directly comparing large numbers of atoms and opens the way to understanding chemical reactions at the molecular level. Exercises in reasoning, using such theories as Gay-Lussac’s law of combining gas volumes and Avogadro’s hypothesis encourage class discussion. The six episodes are: 1. “Relative mass”, 2. “Gas volumes”, 3. “Combining gas volumes”, 4. “Avogadro’s hypothesis”, 5. “Relative atomic mass” and 6. “The Mole”.
